TopicTitle: Revolution... I think the I broke the game a little

Articles.Content:
So I was playing some KSP the other day and came across this...

With some special "Kerbal Engineering" our engineers managed to create this monster Originally intended to be a high orbit relay satellite for communications some alteration during dish extraction caused a chain reaction of rotation.

Who wants a go?

*If this needs moving go ahead, I wasn't sure where it belonged myself

Edited May 14, 2013 by Trux

Scared the crap out of me when you released SE's. LOL

I have no idea what this is, any mods installed?

The music makes me laugh. XP

Thanks :L I thought it fit the theme well and I was in a rush to get the video up

Scared the crap out of me when you released SE's. LOL

I have no idea what this is, any mods installed?

Nope, none on this ship specifically but I do have a few mods installed namely KW, Robot arm and protractor. I might have to use Sub Assembley soon to get a cockpit view, might be useful for reasons
This is the first centrifuge to spin in time as well as in space.
I suppose you could use it to train kerbonauts in preparation for them to go to space?
It's nice to know that I'm not the only one who gets completely impossible phantom forces from the I-beam parts...
on a Kerbalness scale of 1 to 10, this scores somewhere in the Jebediah range

It starts it's phantom rotation as soon as the flight starts, there is no way to stop it either :/ If I can pinpoint the cause I may be able to control it

This is why I love this game so damn much

Sorry to bump my post but this is just too much fun Been Goofing around again and got a Kerbal in there now and the view from the cockpit is nauseating to say the least. I also added all the science parts to the cockpit to do some science stuff. I got some good readings and the highest force old Macbro Kerman experienced was 12G's.

Lets just say that's not all I did... This 30 second clip is the reason why I love KSP so much. Nowhere else can I fling little green men into towers

on a Kerbalness scale of 1 to 10, this scores somewhere in the Jebediah range

Nope This may be closer

I will edit post the craft file and stuff tomorrow.

Edited May 14, 2013 by Trux

The first thing I thought of when I saw this was that old toy that you put your foot through, and spin it around and jump over it, and it counts the rotations. I can't remember the name, but I can picture it perfectly. Dang, this is going to drive me nuts...

The first thing I thought of when I saw this was that old toy that you put your foot through, and spin it around and jump over it, and it counts the rotations. I can't remember the name, but I can picture it perfectly. Dang, this is going to drive me nuts...

I am guessing you are talking about Skip-it.
all I can think of is the face on the kerbal inside
Thank you, Brabbit. I will now be able to sleep tonight.

Thank you, Brabbit. I will now be able to sleep tonight.

=^.^= No problem, I know how that can be.
Outstanding! The music is an awesome touch.
